content.question: Let f be a function such that <math><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>-</mtext><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWdamaabmaabaWdbiaaigdaa8aacaGLOaGaayzkaaWdbiaa bccacqGH9aqpcaqGTaGaaGOmaaaa@3C98@</annotation></semantics></math> and <math><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>7</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWdamaabmaabaWdbiaaiwdaa8aacaGLOaGaayzkaaWdbiaa bccacqGH9aqpcaqGGaGaaG4naaaa@3C94@</annotation></semantics></math> . Which of the following conditions ensures that <math><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWdamaabmaabaWdbiaadogaa8aacaGLOaGaayzkaaWdbiaa bccacqGH9aqpcaqGGaGaaGimaaaa@3CB6@</annotation></semantics></math> for some value c in the open interval f of c, equals 0?

choices.label: f is increasing on the closed interval <math><semantics><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaamWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaigdacaGGSaGaaGynaaWdaiaawUfacaGLDbaaaaa@3A41@</annotation></semantics></math> .

f is continuous on the closed interval <math><semantics><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaamWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaigdacaGGSaGaaGynaaWdaiaawUfacaGLDbaaaaa@3A41@</annotation></semantics></math> .

f is defined for all values of x in the closed interval <math><semantics><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaamWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaigdacaGGSaGaaGynaaWdaiaawUfacaGLDbaaaaa@3A41@</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: f is continuous on the closed interval <math><semantics><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaamWaaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiaaigdacaGGSaGaaGynaaWdaiaawUfacaGLDbaaaaa@3A41@</annotation></semantics></math> .

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
